content.description: This problem would be ultra classic if it weren't for the other boulders adjacent that are difficult not to dab on.  Start on crimps at the lowest part of the roof, and make cool moves along the rail.  At the end of the rail make a big move to a good hold over the lip of the boulder.  Figure out how to adjust / cut your feet without dabbing and move rightwards thru jugs to an easier but pumpy finish.  If you are tall / strong enough to reach the good hold over the lip from the good right hand then this will likely be an easy tick for the grade.
content.protection: Several pads and spotter, there is a hole you could fall into if you come off in the wrong spot.
content.location: Right side of the "Belly of the Beast" boulder.

content.description:
This short problem contains one or two really fun moves but the difficulty is open nearly as soon as it start.  Worth doing if you are here for "Belly of the Beast". 

  Start on the obvious slopers and move rightwards to a good hold on the arete.  Rock over on the arete and climb V0- moves to the top.
content.location: On the opposite rock as "Belly of the Beast"  Start on slopers and move right.

content.description: This small area only contains 3 problems a V5, V7, & V10.  It makes for a good end of the day stop as you will pass by on your way out if you parked in Campground Overflow.
